channel.title: Welcome to GPEML on GPEML Conference
channel.description: Recent content in Welcome to GPEML on GPEML Conference

item.title: Workshop Photos
item.description:
Snapshots from Recent GPEML Workshops

Relive the atmosphere of previous GPEML workshops through a curated selection of photos. More images will be added after each edition.

If you captured memorable moments at GPEML and would like to share them, please email photos@gpeml2025.org.

item.title: Proceedings
item.description:
Conference Proceedings

The proceedings of GPEML will be published and made available to all registered attendees.

Publication Information

  • Publisher: To be announced
  • Format: Digital and Print (if applicable)
  • ISBN: To be assigned
  • DOI: To be assigned

Access

All registered attendees will receive access to the digital proceedings. Proceedings will be available:

  • Online through the conference website
  • Via download link sent to registered attendees
  • On USB drive (if provided at the conference)

Paper Format

Accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings following the Springer LNCS format guidelines.

item.title: Program
item.description:
Conference Program

Stay on top of every session with the confirmed schedule below. Additional days and afternoon sessions will be added once finalized.

Registration

  • July 10, 14:00–21:00: On-site registration opens in the venue lobby.

July 11, 2025 · Morning Sessions

Time Session Chair
9:00–9:30 Opening Ceremony• Speeches from Vice-Presidents• Group Photo Chair: Wei Xu
9:30–10:10 Invited Talk: Linear Genetic ProgrammingSpeaker: Prof. Wolfgang Banzhaf Chair: Jing Liang
10:10–10:30 Tea Break Chair: —
10:30–11:10 Invited Talk: Revisiting Evolutionary Machine Learning – 50 Years of DevelopmentSpeaker: Prof. Mengjie Zhang Chair: Liang Feng
11:10–11:50 Invited Talk: Co-Evolutionary Approach to Program and Test Case Generation with Large Language ModelsSpeaker: Prof. Yuan Yuan Chair: —
11:50–12:20 Panel Discussion: What are the unique advantages of GPEML? What are the biggest bottlenecks in GPEML development and real-world adoption, and how to overcome them?Panelists: Prof. Mengjie Zhang, Prof. Wolfgang Banzhaf, Prof. Chao Qian, Prof. Yuan Yuan, Prof. Yanan Sun Chair: Bing Xue

July 11, 2025 · Afternoon Sessions

Time Session Chair
14:00–14:40 Invited Talk: Evolutionary Learning – From Theory to PracticeSpeaker: Prof. Chao Qian Chair: Yu Xue
14:40–15:20 Invited Talk: Feature Space Transformations with Genetic ProgrammingSpeaker: Prof. Leonardo Trujillo Chair: P. N. Suganthan
15:20–15:40 Tea Break Chair: —
15:40–16:20 Invited Talk: Runtime Analysis of Evolutionary NAS for Multiclass ClassificationSpeaker: Prof. Yanan Sun Chair: Xiny Zhou
16:20–17:00 Invited Talk: How Neutrality Shapes Evolution – Simplicity Bias and SearchSpeaker: A/Prof. Ting Hu Chair: Wenjing Hong
17:00–17:40 Invited Talk: Automated Algorithm Design with Large Language ModelsSpeaker: A/Prof. Zichao Lu Chair: Ying Bi

July 12, 2025 · Morning Sessions

Time Session Chair
9:00–9:40 Invited Talk: Training Autoencoders with Cooperative CoevolutionSpeaker: Dr. Erik Hemberg Chair: Peng Wang
9:40–10:20 Invited Talk: Neural PDE Solvers: From Black-Box Approximators to Transparent Scientific Tools via Evolution-Inspired StrategiesSpeaker: Prof. Min Jiang Chair: Wei Li
10:20–10:40 Tea Break Chair: —
10:40–11:20 Invited Talk: Evolving Models, Exploring Spaces: Evolutionary Computation as a Pathway to Efficiency and CreativitySpeaker: A/Prof. Penousal Machado Chair: Caitong Yue
11:20–12:00 Invited Talk: Genetic Programming for Automated Feature and Model Learning: From Theory to Real-World ApplicationsSpeaker: Prof. Bing Xue Chair: Cuie Yang
12:00–12:30 Panel Discussion: How to Publish GPEML Papers in Top-Tier Conferences and Journals?Panelists: Prof. Bing Xue, A/Prof. Penousal Machado, Prof. Leonardo Trujillo, Prof. Min Jiang, Prof. Jinghui Zhong Chair: Ting Hu

July 12, 2025 · Afternoon Sessions

Time Session Chair
14:00–14:40 Invited Talk: Data-driven Optimization of Complex Systems Assisted by Small and Large ModelsSpeaker: Prof. Yaochu Jin Chair: Mengjie Zhang
14:40–15:20 Invited Talk: Integrating Pretrained Transformers with Genetic Programming for Symbolic RegressionSpeaker: Prof. Jinghui Zhong Chair: Wei Du
15:20–15:40 Tea Break Chair: —
15:40–16:20 Invited Talk: Innovative Applications of Genetic Programming in Agricultural Remote SensingSpeaker: Prof. Miao Lu Chair: Ke Chen
16:20–17:00 Invited Talk: Greedy is Good?!Speaker: A/Prof. Yahui Jia Chair: Qiqi Liu
17:00–17:40 Research on GPEML in Zhengzhou University & Closing CeremonySpeaker: Prof. Ying Bi Chair: Gonglin Yuan

item.title: Registration
item.description:
Conference Registration

Registration for GPEML is now open. All attendees must register to participate in the conference.

Registration Fees

Early Bird Registration (Before September 1, 2025)

  • Regular Attendee: $XXX
  • Student: $XXX
  • IEEE/ACM Member: $XXX

Regular Registration (After September 1, 2025)

  • Regular Attendee: $XXX
  • Student: $XXX
  • IEEE/ACM Member: $XXX

On-Site Registration

  • Regular Attendee: $XXX
  • Student: $XXX
  • IEEE/ACM Member: $XXX

All prices are in USD. Registration fees include: conference proceedings, welcome reception, coffee breaks, and conference dinner.

item.title: Accommodations with Discount
item.description:
We have secured discounted room blocks at hotels within walking distance of the workshop venue. Early booking is strongly recommended; booking codes are required to claim the negotiated rates.

Huazhi Hotel (Conference Venue)

  • Business King Room (single occupancy, 1 breakfast): ¥350 per night
  • Business Twin Room (double occupancy, 2 breakfasts): ¥380 per night
  • Sales Manager: Li Guangxi
  • Contact: +86 156 1791 2750

To guarantee the discounted rate, contact the sales manager directly and mention you are attending GPEML 2025.

item.title: Conference Venue
item.description:
Date & Venue

  • Time: July 10–12, 2025
  • Venue: Huazhi Hotel, Zhengzhou
    • No. 97, Kexue Avenue, Zhongyuan District, Zhengzhou (intersection of Kexue Avenue and Changchun Road)

The Huazhi Hotel offers modern plenary halls, flexible breakout rooms, high-speed Wi-Fi, and seamless catering service for coffee breaks and lunches. Accessibility services are available upon request. Additional logistics and onsite tips will be added as the event approaches.

item.title: Meeting Rooms and Floor Plans
item.description:
Detailed floor plans and room assignments will be published alongside the final programme. Onsite signage and the event app will mirror the information provided here to help you navigate the venue efficiently.

Planned Resources

  • Downloadable PDF map showing plenary, breakout, and poster spaces
  • Accessibility paths and elevator locations
  • Registration desk hours and help-desk locations

Please revisit this page closer to the workshop for the latest layouts.

item.title: Submission
item.description:
Paper Submission

All paper submissions must be made through the conference submission system.

Submission System

Submit your paper here (Link to be updated)

Submission Guidelines

Format Requirements

  • Format: Springer LNCS (Lecture Notes in Computer Science) format
  • Page Limit: Maximum 12 pages (including references)
  • File Format: PDF only
  • Language: English

Paper Categories

  1. Regular Papers - Full research papers (12 pages)
  2. Short Papers - Work-in-progress or position papers (6 pages)

Review Process

  • All papers will undergo a double-blind review process
  • Each paper will be reviewed by at least three program committee members
  • Reviews will be based on originality, technical quality, significance, and clarity

Important Dates

  • Paper Submission Deadline: June 13, 2025
  • Extended Paper Submission Deadline: June 27, 2025 (Anywhere on Earth)
  • Acceptance Notification: August 22, 2025
  • Camera-Ready Submission: September 5, 2025

Submission Checklist

Before submitting, please ensure:

item.title: Calls
item.description:
Calls

This section contains all the calls for participation in GPEML.

Call for Papers

The Program Committee invites original, substantial, and unpublished technical papers on all areas of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.

Deadline: June 13, 2025 (Extended: June 27, 2025)

Call for Workshops

We invite proposals for workshops to be held in conjunction with GPEML.

Deadline: April 22, 2025

Call for Sponsorship

We welcome sponsorship from organizations interested in supporting GPEML.

item.title: Organization
item.description:
Steering Committee

Members of the first Steering Committee are:

Wolfgang Banzhaf

Michigan State University, East Lansing

Mengjie Zhang

Victoria University of Wellington, Wellington

Bing Xue

Victoria University of Wellington, Wellington

Ying Bi

Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou

Chao Qian

Nanjing University, Nanjing

Jinghui Zhong

South China University of Technology, Guangzhou

Yanan Sun

Sichuan University, Chengdu

Cuie Yang

Northeast University, Shenyang

Liang Feng

Chongqing University, Chongqing

1.1 Goals and Duties

  • Promote GPEML in China: Promote Genetic Programming and Evolutionary Machine Learning in China (including Mainland China, Hong Kong, Macau, etc.)
  • Advance research and applications: Promote and enhance research and applications of GPEML in China
  • Foster international collaborations: Promote international collaborations between Chinese GPEML researchers and innovative researchers worldwide
  • Develop young researchers: Develop postgraduate research students and early career researchers to undertake research and applications in GPEML
  • Workshop branding: Establish and update/review the name of the annual workshop (with the possibility to expand it to a conference in the future)
  • Venue and schedule: Determine the venue and dates of each workshop
  • Programme approval: Discuss and approve the draft programme proposed by the organizing committee, including invited speakers of the workshop
  • Format review: Periodically review the workshop format (e.g., invited-speakers-only, paper submissions, student presentations) to ensure effectiveness and alignment with goals
  • Special issues: Facilitate the organisation of special issues derived from the workshop
  • Book publication: Facilitate the organisation of publishing a book in the Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Springer Book Series

1.2 Scope

GPEML focuses on research and applications of Genetic Programming and Evolutionary Machine Learning, with the following major aspects:
